result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott D Slater

defendant.name: Slater, Scott D
defendant.address: C/O Waukesha Co Jail, 515 W Moreland Blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

9:00 AM Defendant Scott D Slater in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Scott D Slater. Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
State places offer on the record.
Court conducts plea colloquy.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
State and Defense make sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statement to the court.

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:
JAIL:   12 MONTHS; 10 MONTHS to be served as Straight-time with balance to be served w/Huber.
0  Days Credit.
Consecutive to any other sentence. 

COSTS:  $268     
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250     
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
**To be converted to a civil judgment. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

NOT CALLED ON THE RECORD:
9:02 AM Defendant Scott D Slater in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Scott D Slater.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Hughes is requesting a plea and sentencing date as soon as possible.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:25 AM Defendant Scott D Slater in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Scott D Slater.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Ted Szczupakiewicz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Waukesha County Deputy Jennifer McIntyre sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Szczupakiewicz.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Atty. Szczupakiewicz moves for bind over.  Atty. Hughes objects to bind over. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

1:12 PM Defendant Scott D Slater in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Attorney Justin Griffis appears as a friend of the Court as the defendant was not on the list as he was not evaluated. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. Preliminary Hearing requested. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
